title: Auto-Antonyms
description: Words that can mean their own opposite

questions.question: The word 'cleave' can mean to split apart OR to do what?
The word 'sanction' can mean to give official approval OR to do what?
When you 'dust' a cake, you add powder. But when you 'dust' furniture, you do what?
The word 'oversight' can mean careful supervision OR what?
'To buckle' can mean to fasten securely. What is its opposite meaning?
If you 'clip' something, you might attach it. But 'clip' can also mean what?
'To seed' a lawn means to add seeds. In cooking, 'to seed' a pepper means what?
'Left' can mean remaining (what's left). It can also mean what?
The word 'fast' can mean moving quickly. As an auto-antonym, it also means what?
'To screen' can mean to show (a film). What is its opposite meaning?
'Weather' can mean to endure something. It can also mean what?
The word 'trim' can mean to add decorations (trim a tree). It also means what?
'To rent' can mean to pay to use something. For a landlord, 'to rent' means what?
options: To allow use in exchange for payment

questions.question: 'Bound' can mean heading toward a destination. As an auto-antonym, it also means what?
The word 'resigned' can mean quit a position. It can also describe someone who is what?
